steps.title: Open Google Chrome .
steps.content: Open Google Chrome . It's the red, yellow, green, and blue sphere app icon.

steps.title: Click the menu ⋮.
steps.content: Click the menu ⋮ . It's the three vertical dots at the top-right corner of Chrome.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . It's near the bottom of the menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the Privacy and security tab.
steps.content: Click the Privacy and security tab. It's in the left panel.

steps.title: Click Site Settings.
steps.content: Click Site Settings . It's in the right panel under "Privacy and security." Additional options will expand.

steps.title: Click Pop-ups and redirects.
steps.content: Click Pop-ups and redirects . It's under the "Content" header toward the bottom of the page. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Sites can send pop-ups and use redirects.
steps.content: Select Sites can send pop-ups and use redirects . This is the first option at the top of the page. As long as this option is selected, websites can show pop-ups in Chrome. If you'd rather just allow pop-ups on some sites, click Add next to "Allowed to send pop-ups and use redirects" at the bottom of the page, enter the website's main URL (e.g., https://www.wikihow.com), and then click Add . You can also unblock pop-ups from a specific site when viewing a website that tries to display one. When a pop-up is blocked, you'll see "Pop-up blocked" and icon that looks like a window with a red-and-white X in the address bar. [3] X Research source When the window opens, click Always allow pop-ups and redirects from (site name) and choose Done . Refresh the page so the settings take effect.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome .
steps.content: Open Google Chrome . Tap the Chrome app icon, which is the yellow, blue, and red sphere in your app list.

steps.title: Tap the three horizontal dots at the bottom-right corner of Chrome.
steps.content: Tap the three horizontal dots at the bottom-right corner of Chrome. A menu will expand. [4] X Research source If you just want to unblock pop-ups from a single site, open the page that displays pop-ups, tap Pop-ups blocked at the bottom, and then tap Always show .

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Content Settings.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Content Settings . This option is near the bottom of the menu. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Block Pop-ups.
steps.content: Tap Block Pop-ups . If you see "Off" next to "Block Pop-ups," pop-ups are not currently blocked. But if you see "On," tap this option to continue.

steps.title: Tap the blue "Block Pop-ups" switch to disable pop-ups.
steps.content: Tap the blue "Block Pop-ups" switch to disable pop-ups . The switch will turn white or gray, which means pop-ups are no longer blocked. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Done.
steps.content: Tap Done . It's in the top-right corner of the screen. This saves your changes.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome .
steps.content: Open Google Chrome . Tap the Chrome app icon, which is a green, yellow, blue, and red sphere.

steps.title: Tap the three-dot menu ⋮.
steps.content: Tap the three-dot menu ⋮ . It's in the top-right corner of the screen next to the address bar. [7] X Research source If you just want to unblock pop-ups from a single site, open the page that displays pop-ups, tap Pop-ups blocked at the bottom, and then tap Always show .

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This option is near the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap Site Settings.
steps.content: Tap Site Settings . You may have to scroll down a little to see this option. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Pop-ups and redirects.
steps.content: Tap Pop-ups and redirects . This displays the pop-ups control switch. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle the "Pop-ups and redirects" switch to the On position .
steps.content: Toggle the "Pop-ups and redirects" switch to the On position . This allows pop-ups in Google Chrome. If the switch is already on (blue), there's no need to make any changes.

steps.title: Open Microsoft Edge.
steps.content: Open Microsoft Edge. You'll find its blue-green wave icon on your Windows Start menu or in your Mac's Applications folder.

steps.title: Click the three horizontal dots ⋯.
steps.content: Click the three horizontal dots ⋯ . It's at the top-right corner of Edge. [10] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This option is at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Click Cookies and site permissions.
steps.content: Click Cookies and site permissions . This tab is on the left side of the Settings page. [11] X Trustworthy Source Microsoft Support Technical support and product information from Microsoft. Go to source

steps.title: Scroll down and click Pop-ups and redirects.
steps.content: Scroll down and click Pop-ups and redirects . You'll find this under "All permissions" in the right panel.

steps.title: Click the blue "Block pop-ups" switch .
steps.content: Click the blue "Block pop-ups" switch . The switch will turn white, which tells Edge to allow pop-ups. [12] X Research source If you want to allow pop-ups from a particular site, just click Add next to "Allow" and enter the site's URL (e.g., https://www.wikihow.com).

steps.title: Open Safari.
steps.content: Open Safari. Click the compass-shaped Safari app icon in your Mac's Dock to do so. If you just want to enable pop-ups for a particular website, go to that website now. Once the site is open, continue to the next step.

steps.title: Click the Safari menu.
steps.content: Click the Safari menu. This menu item is in the top-left corner of the screen. A drop-down menu will appear.

steps.title: Click Preferences….
steps.content: Click Preferences… . It's near the top of the drop-down menu. Doing so prompts a window to open.

steps.title: Click the Websites tab.
steps.content: Click the Websites tab. This is the globe icon at the top of the window.

steps.title: Click Pop-up Windows.
steps.content: Click Pop-up Windows . It's at the bottom of the left panel. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Select Allow from the "When visiting other websites" menu.
steps.content: Select Allow from the "When visiting other websites" menu. This menu is at the bottom-right corner of the screen. When selecting this option, all pop-ups will be allowed through Safari. [14] X Research source If you just want to enable pop-ups for one website, click the menu to the right of its name in the "Currently Open Websites" panel and select Allow .

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . This is the gray gear icon on your home screen or in your App Library. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Safari.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Safari . It's about a third of the way down the Settings page. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle the "Block Pop-ups" switch to the Off position .
steps.content: Toggle the "Block Pop-ups" switch to the Off position . It's in the "GENERAL" section. Turning this switch off allows all pop-ups through Safari. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Open Firefox.
steps.content: Open Firefox . You'll find it in your Windows Start menu or your Mac's Applications folder. If you just want to unblock pop-ups on a specific website, go to that website. When it tries to show a pop-up, you'll see a yellow bar running along the top of the browser that says "Firefox prevented this site from opening (number of) pop-up windows." To allow pop-ups from this site, click the Options button on the yellow bar and select Allow pop-ups for this site . [18] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Firefox Settings.
steps.content: Open your Firefox Settings. The steps are a little different depending on your operating system: Windows: Click the three horizontal lines at the top-right corner and select Settings . macOS: Click the Firefox menu in the menu bar and select Preferences .

steps.title: Click the Privacy & Security tab.
steps.content: Click the Privacy & Security tab. It's on the left side of the window. [19] X Research source

steps.title: Uncheck the "Block pop-up windows" box.
steps.content: Uncheck the "Block pop-up windows" box. This option is near the bottom of the "Permissions" section in the right panel. Removing the checkmark allows pop-ups to come through in Firefox. Alternatively, you can click Exceptions... to the right of the "Block pop-up windows" box, type in a website's address, click Allow , and click Save Changes to allow pop-ups for a specific site, but not your entire browser.

steps.title: Open Firefox on your iPhone.
steps.content: Open Firefox on your iPhone. Tap the Firefox app icon, which is the orange fox wrapped around a purple globe. There is no longer a way to allow pop-ups in the Android version of Firefox. This is because the latest versions of Firefox disable the advanced configuration editor. If pop-ups are necessary, use Google Chrome.

steps.title: Tap the three horizontal lines ☰.
steps.content: Tap the three horizontal lines ☰ . This icon is at the bottom of the screen. [20] X Research source This displays the menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . This is the gear icon at the bottom of the menu.

steps.title: Tap the blue "Block Pop-up Windows" switch .
steps.content: Tap the blue "Block Pop-up Windows" switch . This disables pop-up blocking, allowing you to see pop-ups when browsing with Firefox.
